description: Describes your route tables. The default is to describe all your route tables. Alternatively, you can specify specific route table IDs or filter the results to include only the route tables that match specific criteria. Each subnet in your VPC must be associated with a route table. If a subnet is not explicitly associated with any route table, it is implicitly associated with the main route table. This command does not return the subnet ID for implicit associations. For more information, see Route tables in the Amazon VPC User Guide.

parameters.name: RouteTableIds
parameters.description: The IDs of the route tables. (string) ---

parameters.name: Filters
parameters.description: The filters. association.gateway-id - The ID of the gateway involved in the association. association.route-table-association-id - The ID of an association ID for the route table. association.route-table-id - The ID of the route table involved in the association. association.subnet-id - The ID of the subnet involved in the association. association.main - Indicates whether the route table is the main route table for the VPC ( true | false). Route tables that do not have an association ID are not returned in the response. owner-id - The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that owns the route table. route-table-id - The ID of the route table. route.destination-cidr-block - The IPv4 CIDR range specified in a route in the table. route.destination-ipv6-cidr-block - The IPv6 CIDR range specified in a route in the route table. route.destination-prefix-list-id - The ID (prefix) of the Amazon Web Services service specified in a route in the table. route.egress-only-internet-gateway-id - The ID of an egress-only Internet gateway specified in a route in the route table. route.gateway-id - The ID of a gateway specified in a route in the table. route.instance-id - The ID of an instance specified in a route in the table. route.nat-gateway-id - The ID of a NAT gateway. route.transit-gateway-id - The ID of a transit gateway. route.origin - Describes how the route was created. CreateRouteTable indicates that the route was automatically created when the route table was created; CreateRoute indicates that the route was manually added to the route table; EnableVgwRoutePropagation indicates that the route was propagated by route propagation. route.state - The state of a route in the route table ( active | blackhole). The blackhole state indicates that the route's target isn't available (for example, the specified gateway isn't attached to the VPC, the specified NAT instance has been terminated, and so on). route.vpc-peering-connection-id - The ID of a VPC peering connection specified in a route in the table. tag - The key/value combination of a tag assigned to the resource. Use the tag key in the filter name and the tag value as the filter value. For example, to find all resources that have a tag with the key Owner and the value TeamA, specify tag:Owner for the filter name and TeamA for the filter value. tag-key - The key of a tag assigned to the resource. Use this filter to find all resources assigned a tag with a specific key, regardless of the tag value. vpc-id - The ID of the VPC for the route table. (dict) --- A filter name and value pair that is used to return a more specific list of results from a describe operation. Filters can be used to match a set of resources by specific criteria, such as tags, attributes, or IDs. If you specify multiple filters, the filters are joined with an AND, and the request returns only results that match all of the specified filters. For more information, see List and filter using the CLI and API in the Amazon EC2 User Guide. Name (string) --- The name of the filter. Filter names are case-sensitive. Values (list) --- The filter values. Filter values are case-sensitive. If you specify multiple values for a filter, the values are joined with an OR, and the request returns all results that match any of the specified values. (string) ---

nested_items.name: RouteTables
nested_items.description: Information about the route tables.

nested_items.name: Associations
nested_items.description: The associations between the route table and your subnets or gateways.

nested_items.name: Main
nested_items.description: Indicates whether this is the main route table.

nested_items.name: RouteTableAssociationId
nested_items.description: The ID of the association.

nested_items.name: RouteTableId
nested_items.description: The ID of the route table.

nested_items.name: SubnetId
nested_items.description: The ID of the subnet. A subnet ID is not returned for an implicit association.

nested_items.name: GatewayId
nested_items.description: The ID of the internet gateway or virtual private gateway.

nested_items.name: AssociationState
nested_items.description: The state of the association.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The state of the association.

nested_items.name: StatusMessage
nested_items.description: The status message, if applicable.

nested_items.name: PropagatingVgws
nested_items.description: Any virtual private gateway (VGW) propagating routes.

nested_items.name: GatewayId
nested_items.description: The ID of the virtual private gateway.

nested_items.name: RouteTableId
nested_items.description: The ID of the route table.

nested_items.name: Routes
nested_items.description: The routes in the route table.

nested_items.name: DestinationCidrBlock
nested_items.description: The IPv4 CIDR block used for the destination match.

nested_items.name: DestinationIpv6CidrBlock
nested_items.description: The IPv6 CIDR block used for the destination match.

nested_items.name: DestinationPrefixListId
nested_items.description: The prefix of the Amazon Web Services service.

nested_items.name: EgressOnlyInternetGatewayId
nested_items.description: The ID of the egress-only internet gateway.

nested_items.name: GatewayId
nested_items.description: The ID of a gateway attached to your VPC.

nested_items.name: InstanceId
nested_items.description: The ID of a NAT instance in your VPC.

nested_items.name: InstanceOwnerId
nested_items.description: The ID of Amazon Web Services account that owns the instance.

nested_items.name: NatGatewayId
nested_items.description: The ID of a NAT gateway.

nested_items.name: TransitGatewayId
nested_items.description: The ID of a transit gateway.

nested_items.name: LocalGatewayId
nested_items.description: The ID of the local gateway.

nested_items.name: CarrierGatewayId
nested_items.description: The ID of the carrier gateway.

nested_items.name: NetworkInterfaceId
nested_items.description: The ID of the network interface.

nested_items.name: Origin
nested_items.description: Describes how the route was created.
CreateRouteTable - The route was automatically created when the route table was created.
CreateRoute - The route was manually added to the route table.
EnableVgwRoutePropagation - The route was propagated by route propagation.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The state of the route. The blackhole state indicates that the route's target isn't available (for example, the specified gateway isn't attached to the VPC, or the specified NAT instance has been terminated).

nested_items.name: VpcPeeringConnectionId
nested_items.description: The ID of a VPC peering connection.

nested_items.name: CoreNetworkArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the core network.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: Any tags assigned to the route table.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The key of the tag.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value of the tag.

nested_items.name: VpcId
nested_items.description: The ID of the VPC.

nested_items.name: OwnerId
nested_items.description: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that owns the route table.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: The token to include in another request to get the next page of items. This value is null when there are no more items to return.
